think_procedure: 1. Identify the knob 'max_parallel_workers_per_gather' in PostgreSQL. 2. Understand its regular operation, which is to set the maximum number of parallel workers that can be started by a single Gather node. 3. Check if this knob has any special values that deviate from its numerical order and perform a different function. 4. Discover that setting this knob to 0 disables parallel query execution, which is a different function from its regular operation. 5. Conclude that 'max_parallel_workers_per_gather' is a special knob because it has a special value (0) that changes its functionality.
